rules.natural: The proceedings are distributed, or the tech conference event occurs.
The projector has a device malfunction, or it is not the case that the proceedings are distributed.
Provided that a primary check of System A is performed, if it is not the case that a projector malfunction implies a tech team intervention, then the presentation is not delayed.
A primary check of System A is performed, or a secondary check of System B is performed.
Under the condition that the live stream fails, an archive recording becomes available.
If the live stream fails, then it is not the case that an archive recording is available.
If registration is open for the event, then the tech conference event occurs.
Provided that walk-ins are allowed for the event, the tech conference event occurs.
If the keynote speaker is ready, then the keynote is scheduled in the main hall.
Given that the major sponsor is confirmed, if it is not the case that registration is open or walk-ins are allowed, then attendee attendance is not capped.
The convention center is confirmed as the venue, or the major sponsor is confirmed.
A press release is issued, or if the tech conference event does not occur, then a virtual online access option is available.
There is a media blackout, or it is not the case that a press release is issued.
The schedule is locked, or it is not the case that there is a media blackout.
If there is a last-minute change, then the schedule is not locked.
There is a last-minute change, or an emergency override is enacted.
Under the condition that an emergency override is enacted, the schedule is not locked.
Provided that networking is enabled for the networking event, the tech conference event occurs.
If the backup speaker is ready, then the tech conference event occurs.
Given that a safety check is performed by the security team, if networking is not enabled for the networking event, then the social gathering is not canceled.
Whenever a safety check is performed by the fire marshal, under the condition that networking is not enabled for the networking event, the social gathering is not canceled.
If there is a primary approval by the security chief, then a safety check is performed by the security team.
There is a primary approval by the security chief, or there is a secondary approval by the deputy chief.
Provided that there is a secondary approval by the deputy chief, a safety check is performed by the fire marshal.
If the proceedings are digital only, then it is not the case that the proceedings are distributed.
The proceedings are digital only, or the proceedings are available in print.

Feedback is collected via surveys, or if the courier delivery is verified, then provided that the distribution team confirms distribution, under the condition that the proceedings are available in print, the proceedings are not distributed.
If the timeslots are fixed, then the agenda is published.
Given that the event coordinator is verified, whenever the schedule is locked, the timeslots are fixed.
The event coordinator is verified, or the assistant is verified.
Provided that the assistant is verified, if the schedule is locked, then the timeslots are fixed.
The AV team is alerted, or the stage manager is alerted.
Whenever the stage manager is alerted, under the condition that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

Provided that Contingency Plan B is activated, if the AV team is alerted, then given that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

If Contingency Plan C is activated, then under the condition that the AV team is alerted, provided that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.
The logistics director is informed, or Contingency Plan B is activated, or Contingency Plan C is activated.
If it is not the case that a projector malfunction implies a tech team intervention, then the presentation is delayed.

If it is not the case that a secondary check of System B being performed implies that the lack of a projector malfunction leading to tech intervention prevents a presentation delay, then the live stream fails.
Under the condition that it is not the case that registration is open or walk-ins are allowed, attendee attendance is capped.
Given that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is canceled.
Whenever networking is not enabled for the networking event, the social gathering is canceled.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the keynote is scheduled in the main hall, or the tech conference event occurs.

(A10 ∨ G).natural: The proceedings are distributed, or the tech conference event occurs.

(A11 → A12).natural: If the projector has a device malfunction, then a tech intervention by the tech team follows.

(A11 ∨ ¬A10).natural: The projector has a device malfunction, or it is not the case that the proceedings are distributed.

(A14 → (¬(A11 → A12) → ¬A13)).natural: Provided that a primary check of System A is performed, if it is not the case that a projector malfunction implies a tech team intervention, then the presentation is not delayed.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: A primary check of System A is performed, or a secondary check of System B is performed.

(A15 → (¬(A11 → A12) → ¬A13)).natural: Whenever a secondary check of System B is performed, given that a projector malfunction does not necessitate a tech team intervention, the presentation is not delayed.

(A16 → A17).natural: Under the condition that the live stream fails, an archive recording becomes available.

(A16 → ¬A17).natural: If the live stream fails, then it is not the case that an archive recording is available.

(A18 → G).natural: If registration is open for the event, then the tech conference event occurs.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either registration is open for the event, or walk-ins are allowed for the event.

(A19 → G).natural: Provided that walk-ins are allowed for the event, the tech conference event occurs.

(A2 → A1).natural: If the keynote speaker is ready, then the keynote is scheduled in the main hall.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: The keynote speaker is ready, or the backup speaker is ready.

(A21 → (¬(A18 ∨ A19) → ¬A20)).natural: Given that the major sponsor is confirmed, if it is not the case that registration is open or walk-ins are allowed, then attendee attendance is not capped.

(A22 ∨ A21).natural: The convention center is confirmed as the venue, or the major sponsor is confirmed.

(A24 ∨ (¬G → A23)).natural: A press release is issued, or if the tech conference event does not occur, then a virtual online access option is available.

(A25 ∨ ¬A24).natural: There is a media blackout, or it is not the case that a press release is issued.

(A26 → A40).natural: Whenever the schedule is locked, the agenda is published.

(A26 → A41).natural: If the schedule is locked, then the timeslots are fixed.

(A26 ∨ ¬A25).natural: The schedule is locked, or it is not the case that there is a media blackout.

(A27 → ¬A26).natural: If there is a last-minute change, then the schedule is not locked.

(A27 ∨ A28).natural: There is a last-minute change, or an emergency override is enacted.

(A28 → ¬A26).natural: Under the condition that an emergency override is enacted, the schedule is not locked.

(A29 → G).natural: Provided that networking is enabled for the networking event, the tech conference event occurs.

(A3 → G).natural: If the backup speaker is ready, then the tech conference event occurs.

(A31 → (¬A29 → ¬A30)).natural: Given that a safety check is performed by the security team, if networking is not enabled for the networking event, then the social gathering is not canceled.

(A31 ∨ A32).natural: A safety check is performed by the security team, or a safety check is performed by the fire marshal.

(A32 → (¬A29 → ¬A30)).natural: Whenever a safety check is performed by the fire marshal, under the condition that networking is not enabled for the networking event, the social gathering is not canceled.

(A33 → A31).natural: If there is a primary approval by the security chief, then a safety check is performed by the security team.

(A33 ∨ A34).natural: There is a primary approval by the security chief, or there is a secondary approval by the deputy chief.

(A34 → A32).natural: Provided that there is a secondary approval by the deputy chief, a safety check is performed by the fire marshal.

(A35 → ¬A10).natural: If the proceedings are digital only, then it is not the case that the proceedings are distributed.

(A35 ∨ A36).natural: The proceedings are digital only, or the proceedings are available in print.

(A36 → ¬A10).natural: Under the condition that the proceedings are available in print, the proceedings are not distributed.

(A37 → (A36 → ¬A10)).natural: Provided that the distribution team confirms distribution, if the proceedings are available in print, then the proceedings are not distributed.

(A38 → (A37 → (A36 → ¬A10))).natural: If the courier delivery is verified, then given that the distribution team confirms distribution, whenever the proceedings are available in print, the proceedings are not distributed.

(A39 ∨ (A38 → (A37 → (A36 → ¬A10)))).natural: Feedback is collected via surveys, or if the courier delivery is verified, then provided that the distribution team confirms distribution, under the condition that the proceedings are available in print, the proceedings are not distributed.

(A41 → A40).natural: If the timeslots are fixed, then the agenda is published.

(A42 → (A26 → A41)).natural: Given that the event coordinator is verified, whenever the schedule is locked, the timeslots are fixed.

(A42 ∨ A43).natural: The event coordinator is verified, or the assistant is verified.

(A43 → (A26 → A41)).natural: Provided that the assistant is verified, if the schedule is locked, then the timeslots are fixed.

(A5 → (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4)).natural: If the AV team is alerted, then given that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

(A5 ∨ A6).natural: The AV team is alerted, or the stage manager is alerted.

(A6 → (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4)).natural: Whenever the stage manager is alerted, under the condition that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

(A7 → (A5 → (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4))).natural: Provided that Contingency Plan B is activated, if the AV team is alerted, then given that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Contingency Plan B is activated, or Contingency Plan C is activated.

(A8 → (A5 → (¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4))).natural: If Contingency Plan C is activated, then under the condition that the AV team is alerted, provided that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

(A9 ∨ (A7 ∨ A8)).natural: The logistics director is informed, or Contingency Plan B is activated, or Contingency Plan C is activated.

(¬(A11 → A12) → A13).natural: If it is not the case that a projector malfunction implies a tech team intervention, then the presentation is delayed.

(¬(A11 → A12) → ¬A13).natural: Provided that it is not the case that a projector malfunction implies a tech team intervention, the presentation is not delayed.

(¬(A15 → (¬(A11 → A12) → ¬A13)) → A16).natural: If it is not the case that a secondary check of System B being performed implies that the lack of a projector malfunction leading to tech intervention prevents a presentation delay, then the live stream fails.

(¬(A18 ∨ A19) → A20).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that registration is open or walk-ins are allowed, attendee attendance is capped.

(¬(A18 ∨ A19) → ¬A20).natural: If it is not the case that registration is open or walk-ins are allowed, then attendee attendance is not capped.

(¬(A2 ∨ A3) → A4).natural: Given that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is canceled.

(¬(A2 ∨ A3) → ¬A4).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the keynote speaker is ready or the backup speaker is ready, the keynote is not canceled.

(¬A29 → A30).natural: Whenever networking is not enabled for the networking event, the social gathering is canceled.

(¬A29 → ¬A30).natural: If networking is not enabled for the networking event, then the social gathering is not canceled.

(¬G → A23).natural: If the tech conference event does not occur, then a virtual online access option is available.

A29.natural: Networking is enabled for the networking event.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the keynote is scheduled in the main hall.

¬A11.natural: The projector does not have a device malfunction.

¬A12.natural: There is no tech intervention by the tech team.

¬A16.natural: The live stream does not fail.

¬A22.natural: It is not the case that the convention center is confirmed as the venue.

¬A23.natural: A virtual online access option is not available.

¬A39.natural: Feedback is not collected via surveys.

¬A9.natural: The logistics director is not informed.
